Physical Exam: General physical examination including vital signs (blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature)
Justification: To assess overall health and rule out any underlying medical conditions that may be contributing to sleep issues.

Physical Exam: Neurological examination (including assessment of mental status, reflexes, and coordination)
Justification: To evaluate cognitive function and rule out any neurological causes of sleep disturbances.

Physical Exam: Thyroid examination (palpation of the thyroid gland)
Justification: To check for any thyroid abnormalities that could affect sleep patterns.
To assess for any gastrointestinal issues that may be affecting sleep, such as discomfort or reflux.

Physical Exam: Mental health assessment (including mood and anxiety evaluation)
Justification: To evaluate for any signs of anxiety or depression that may be contributing to sleep difficulties.
